meanings.definition: To cease to use or practice
meanings.sent1: She disuses her old toys when she gets new ones.
meanings.sent2: He disuses his old phone after upgrading to a new model.
meanings.sent3: The robot disuses its malfunctioning arm and switches to the backup.
meanings.sent4: The athlete disuses his old training routine in favor of a more effective one.
meanings.sent5: The chef disuses the outdated recipe and experiments with new flavors.

meanings.definition: The state of not being used or practiced
meanings.sent1: The disuses of the old factory led to its closure.
meanings.sent2: The disuses of the park equipment made it unsafe for children.
meanings.sent3: The disuses of the ancient language made it difficult to translate.
meanings.sent4: The disuses of the old road resulted in it being overgrown with plants.
meanings.sent5: The disuses of the traditional method paved the way for innovation.
